result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Ray Shadle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Restitution set at $0.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
DNA surcharges and related surcharges WAIVED as defendant was ordered to provide and pay surcharges on case 15CF00060, if he had not already provided a sample.
Concurrent with: concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Sara C., Corina H-L., Pick-N-Save located at 1818 W. National Avenue and 250 West Holt Avenue.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications as prescribed by therapist and cooperate with any treatment and follow-up treatment with diagnosis.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-DNA surcharges and related surcharges WAIVED as defendant was ordered to provide and pay surcharges on case 15CF00060, if he had not already provided a sample.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications as prescribed by therapist and cooperate with any treatment and follow-up treatment with diagnosis 
-No contact with Sara C., Corina H-L., Pick-N-Save located at 1818 W. National Avenue and 250 West Holt Avenue
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-DNA surcharges and related surcharges WAIVED as defendant was ordered to provide and pay surcharges on case 15CF00060, if he had not already provided a sample.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications as prescribed by therapist and cooperate with any treatment and follow-up treatment with diagnosis 
-No contact with Sara C., Corina H-L., Pick-N-Save located at 1818 W. National Avenue and 250 West Holt Avenue
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his 
civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties here on State's motion challenging the finding of competency of the defendant. Sworn for the state: Dr. Robert Rawski. Parties rest. Court finds the defendant to be competent and orders the record to reflect as such.
Branch 21 is in jury trial and is unable to hear this matter.  Branch 38 will now hear this matter.  Parties notified, and case sent forthwith.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.  A plea and sentencing date was also selected. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
